meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>compete</kanji> so the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to compete</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You really have <vocabulary>to compete</vocabulary> for <reading>key so</reading>ap (きそ). These days everyone wants their keys as clean as possible, and the special key soap they use is pretty hard to come by. Whenever it's in stock again people try to compete over it. Just imagine all those shoppers fighting over some key soap…
